reviews.review: the story line was really good and the music was good as well
The movie wasn't all it could have been, yet it still remains an exceptional example of how to handle a follow-up movie. Overall, wonderfully charming and well-writen.
the story is not as compelling as the first one.
Good movie better then the first movie

Before I dispense my opinion an interesting fact for you all, although Disney has made many sequels to its animated film, only one animated sequel has made it to cinema release before Frozen 2. (Kudos to anyone who can name that film) Now you may be wondering why that is, well watch this film and you might realise why that is, a quality sequel is very hard to achieve. I avoided the original Frozen for as long as possible but once I cracked and watched it,I could not deny that it was brilliant, the songs were so catchy and the subversive plot was a refreshing take on a classic fable. The sequel however loses most of what made the first film so good. The plot itself feels thin at best and the film goes to great lengths to rewrite some of the more powerful themes from the first movie. The songs are mostly forgettable apart from a hilarious power ballad from Kristoff. Even with all the negatives it is still watchable, Olaf is hilarious, there are some brilliant disney Easter eggs and no one does a happy ending like Disney does. Overall it is not a bad film but it does feel unnecessary and more of a cash cow than a worth while continuation of the Frozen tale. I give it 3 out of 5 spirits.
It's better than the first one
Olaf was hilarious, but the rest of the movie was just boring. I expected so much more

The movie was fabulous I didnt realize the show was so small so we were sitting a little bit too close to the screen And I felt that the 21 for adults and 18 for children were a little high for such a small theater
Fantastic follow up to the first movie! Loved the visuals as well as the songs.
Frozen 2. Explains instead of shows. I can't remember a movie that has as much exposition in the dialogue. Pathetic storytelling. Worst Disney in 20 years.
